name: Julius Caesar
what_did:
Caesar was a powerful general who conquered many lands for Rome, including Gaul (modern France).
He became so popular that he was declared 'dictator for life'.
Some people feared he had too much power — he was assassinated by a group of senators.
why_matters:
Caesar changed the Roman Republic forever, leading to the rise of the Roman Empire.
His actions and death marked the end of one kind of government and the start of another.
He’s one of the most famous figures in ancient history.
